page.title: 15ROBIN HILL COUNTRY PARK
page.content: Robin Hill Country Park is situated 3.5 km east of Newport.It has been open since 1969.Before then it was rough downland and in parts was quite dangerous. The purpose of Robin Hill is to keep for the public rare and exotic creatures. There are now about 6 buildings on the 90 acre site positioned on one side of a valley which includes a 0.5 acre pond. Also on the site is a Roman villa it is dated from about 2oo to 300 AD . It has now been covered over due to the frost. There are over 100 species of birds and animals including 60 different species of Turtle. Mr. Fleming, the owner , said the cost of running Robin Hill was high.
